Reviews.Title: “Very close to excellent”
Reviews.Author: Martin G
Reviews.Content: I stay there for five days on a business trip to Indianapolis. Town center is easy to reach by interstate. Receptionist and management are very friendly and helpful. Managed by a indian family. Very cleanThe room was huge and the hotel is not very old. But in some very small parts it already needs some minor renorvations. No big problems - some colour will do. Similar with the room service: one day the "ground-towel" for the shower was missing. On two days the creamer for the coffee was missing. But I am sure just one call would have solved the little problem. Outside the room there was a ugly smell (from a cleaner or detergent??). Without this little problems it would have received "an excellent"! On the weekend a few "party people" are staying there. No problem. Good talks, nice people. Free WiFi. Plenty of value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “You will not regret staying here”
Reviews.Author: Leah G
Reviews.Content: If you are going to make a trip to Indianapolis in the near future, I strongly suggest that you make an effort to stay at the Indianapolis Days Inn & Suites Castleton. The room was very clean and looked like it was being taken care of regularly. Also, the rooms were large which was nice because my family was there. The people at the front desk were pleasant too; they help us find places to go during the day that would be fun for the entire family. The only thing that I could think of that I did not like was some of the other guests in the hotel were a little loud. The location is also a bonus. There are lots of different restaurants around the area of the hotel. The breakfast they have was very nice. There was all types of breakfast foods on a table waiting for anyone to eat it. I had a really good experience at this hotel and I do recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Disgusting...see photos!”
Reviews.Author: Kingy026
Reviews.Content: I was unfortunately booked in this hotel the week prior to Superbowl with at least 15 other television production guys. We had no control or choice in the matter. We were all working together in Indianappolis. In my first photo, I HAD to document my discovery of Astro Glide and condoms in the night stand. I mean, REALLY??!! The Astroglide had leaked all over the drawer. Notice it's placement next to the Gideon Bible. I heard from at least two other people they found condoms in their rooms as well. The stains and smells were horrible in everyone's rooms. NON smoking rooms had ash trays and cigarette burns on the counters. Lots of unidentifiable stains, reminisent of crime scenes. One guy had a room with bullet holes and he swore there were blood stains. I had to stand in ankle deep water in the shower while trying to ignore the buckled linoleum tiles, and mildewed shower curtain. On the back wall of the closet, I am sure someone had urinated on it. The water stains on the ceiling painted over with spray paint didn't really hide anything. One guy actually went to Target to buy towels because whatever they had that resembled towels was more like sandpaper. When I slid the window open in my room to get some "fresh" air in, the whole pane fell out onto me. I'm glad I was on the second floor. There was trash everywhere in the parking lot and the empty lot behind the hotel. The elevator was "out of order" by the second day. I do have to say they got that fixed by the third day. The fluorescent hospital lighting was more than depressing. I have never stayed at hotel where there were condoms and lube sold at the front counter. The free breakfast consisted of cereal, bagels, OJ, Apple juice, and pre packaged sweet rolls. Oh, and some apples and bananas. I never had a cup of coffee without it always having grounds in it. Overall, I had to laugh about it all since I was stuck and had to stay there for 5 days working. It was just a place to sleep, or at least try to sleep while worrying about bed bugs. Other guys complained to get a new room, but only ended up with more problems. I would suggest that you go 1 mile down the road and look at Hampton Inn, Comfort Inn, or anything else than this Days Inn & Suites. Unless you're looking for a hotel that has an Hourly rate, IF you know what I mean...

Reviews.Title: “Rough edges, but OK place to stay”
Reviews.Author: FunnyFisher
Reviews.Content: Stayed here because it was the only Wyndham hotel in the city that would accommodate the remaining points I had left in my rewards account. We booked it expecting an average place - and got just that. The hallway was a bit rough - moulding torn up, minor stains in the carpet, but nothing that would have turned me away. The room was spacious, and provided my family with what we needed for a trip to Indy. They have a breakfast area, and we were suprised at all that was offered. The photo on the hotel's web site made it look like there was nothing more than cereal and donuts, but there were also bagels, muffins, assorted drinks, and fruit. Rooms could have used a bit more vacuum work - especially around the beds (dirt you do not see when you have the bedspread on), but again, nothing that freaked us out too much. We have stayed in Days Inn establishments that have been nothing but discouraging - and this one was much better than the average dumpy Days Inn out there. Thought it was funny - you can buy both ramen noodles and codoms on the display wall behind the front desk! Classy date night for some, I guess!?!? :-) (I travel all over the country with my job, and I contribute on EVERY hotel I stay in. Trip Advisor has been a great tool for me, and I contribute fairly, for both good and bad facilities.)

Reviews.Title: “This place needs condemned!”
Reviews.Author: Dave Bowman
Reviews.Content: First thing that worried me was types of people hanging out around the outside of the hotel. The next thing was ants on the table between the beds. I immediately went to front desk and cancelled my reservation! I felt like I needed to be carry my personal protection sidearm!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Hoosierfan_7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were visiting family and needed a place to stay for one night. With the Brickyard race going on we weren't sure if we would be able to find a place at the last minute. We drove to the hotel around 10 p.m and after checking with the desk clerk found that rooms were available at a rate of $49.00 plus tax and fees. We were apprehensive about what we would find when we opened the door to the room, but were pleasantly surprised that it was a decent room for a one night stay. The beds were comfortable and the bathroom appeared clean. The furnishings were not top quality, but the room had two sinks as well as a small refrigerator (which we didn't use). The carpets needed a good vacuuming in the room as well as the hallways, but I never walk without shoes in any hotel room anyway. We travel to the Indianapolis area very frequently and have always stayed in more expensive hotels, but this hotel was sufficient for a good night's sleep. I saw a sign that did allow pets, which usually is when I leave, but after a good spraying of the room with Lysol I figured any pet smells/etc. would be gone.

Reviews.Title: “Days Inn "The Hood"”
Reviews.Author: 1Timer
Reviews.Content: This was one of the worst hotel we ever stay in.The rooms were very dirty and smell really bad,like the people who stay in before us were smokin crack.Furniture & TV were back from the 80's"early".People walking around late at night like they were lookin for a hit.Don't let the pic and the loclation fool you.You can tell the front desk people are doing something fishy. DON"T GOOOOO

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal for One Night”
Reviews.Author: dress19
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Indianapolis for a friend's wedding and needed somewhere inexpensive to stay since I was not going to be in the room much. Days Inn was a convenient location near shops and restaurants. The room was clean and very spacious, but rather run down. A little updating could go a long way. But, the stay was exactly what I expected for the price I paid.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome Stay, Excellent Services, World Channels”
Reviews.Author: SK787
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my family on Indy-500 Weekend and it was awsome stay there. The room was neat, large like suite room, clean, and looks like new. The service was excellent too even though we checked In after midnight, and they have world channels of different country. We enjoyed some party music too which didn't disturb us and we enjoyed it. We also got some free gifts from the front desk guy. Overall it was Nice and Excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “No hot water and no toilet paper.”
Reviews.Author: bmg656
Reviews.Content: Had to call the front desk everytime we wanted to take a shower because there was no hot water. We ran out of toilet paper and Ameil (sp) told us to come down to the front desk and pick it up ourselves. No clean towels from Thursday thru Monday because they only service the rooms on Monday, Wednesday, and Friday. Since we did not check in until Thursday we were not scheduled on Friday. So, no clean sheets, no toilet paper, no hot water, no clean towels no soap. The breakfast consisted of coffee, orange juice, apple juice, bread to make toast, bagels, a pastry, and two kinds of cold cereal. Nothing hot and no fruit or eggs or yogurt. no microwave, small refrig no freezer part tho...But we did get great reception on the Indian TV channels. Although, at one point, the phones were down and following that was the internet. The next day we were told that they were down until 3am, then back up.

Reviews.Title: “decent size room, but the bathroom was gross!!”
Reviews.Author: sarajorn
Reviews.Content: We basically chose this motel for a cheap place to sleep. The room itself was a pleasant surprise, bigger than I anticipated for the price. The room (not the bathroom) was clean, beds were fairly comfortable, and the room was pretty quiet overall. The mini fridge had no temperature control, as the control knob was broken off. My biggest issue was with the cleanliness of the bathroom. IT wasn't awful, but there were hairs in the sink and I didn't get any feeling that the room had been sanitized. The breakfast was decent, although we were in a hurry and just grabbed something to go. Check-in was painfully slow, but the staff was friendly. Overall, I guess you get what you pay for!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Place. But they have Indian TV channels (LOL)”
Reviews.Author: TravelJewels45
Reviews.Content: One of the worst hotels I've ever stayed. The room was filthy, the lobby had so much stuff behind the desk I thought it was a dollar store. Check in dude gave us free Advil packets... that expired last year! Unfortunately, we had to be in Indianapolis for l day.... the weekend of the Indy. Paid over $100 for their horrible room. Hallways smelled terrible. It should never be part of the Days Inn franchise network. We think they cater to those who have traveled from India or those of Indian descent. TV had 6 channels all speaking in their native tongues. Seedy people were hanging around outside smoking up a storm. Beds were dirty, carpet had stains of unknown origins. Someone else made the reservation and didn't check trip advisor. Please take my advice, from a seasoned traveler who has seen it all..... stay away at any cost.

Reviews.Title: “Very gross!”
Reviews.Author: travchi
Reviews.Content: I was going to see a concert in Noblesville, and this hotel showed up on a website... I figured a days inn would not be anything special but that it would be okay. the hallways smelled of smoke and the boxspring in the room had browish red spots on it.... (they had nothing covering the box spring). The bathroom was REALLY GROSS! the bathtub had chips in it and the floor had what looked like mildew growing on it next to the tub. the price was approx $100 a night and for that much money i would expect a clean room at the very least. i don't ever plan to stay there again when there are MANY more hotels in the area!

Reviews.Title: “The Good & VERY Bad - Proceed with Caution!”
Reviews.Author: BritYank
Reviews.Content: The Good: Four of us stayed at this hotel two weeks ago. I personally chose this hotel and made the initial reservation for 2 couples, 2 rooms, 2 nights (Fri, Sat). We later changed the reservation to 1 couple for 2 nights (F, S) and 1 couple for 1 night (S). Our friends booked in on Friday and were very satisfied with their room and the facility. At 6:00 p.m. Saturday, we booked in, and were also very satisfied with the facility and reception staff. We saw none of the bad things mentioned in previous reviews. It appeared to be an acceptable, pet friendly hotel, offered at an extremely reasonable rate. In fact, I told them I would submit a favorable review to Tripadvisor. Remember, if it seems too good to be true, it probably is. The VERY Bad: After reading the reviews I almost cancelled the reservation. However, we each had a dog with us so decided stay to attend the UFO (Frisbee Dog) competition. Soon after we arrived in our room, our friends informed us that one of their bags was missing (including a $1,300 video camera). In addition, all their personal items had been packed up and put into their remaining bags. After checking with the front desk, it was determined that there was some confusion over the booking, and they mistakenly thought our friends had overstayed their reservation. The staff entered their room, packed all their belongings and moved them to a storage area downstairs. When they realized their mistake, they took their bags back to the room - minus the bag with the electronic equipment. After almost two hours of management trying to locate staff that removed the bags, our friends called the police. The police arrived and told them a report would be filed, but in all likelihood, the items would not be returned. Sunday morning, staff had been interviewed and maintained that they returned all the bags - they did NOT! To top it all, this hotel still charged our friends for their room, accepting no responsibility and offering no compensation. This situation and the management‘s response is appalling. After all, the room wasn’t broken into, they admitted that they removed the bags. To date, this has not been resolved. Proceed with caution if you book at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy and Unhelpful”
Reviews.Author: brfitzgenyc
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel, we thought it would be fine, as the lobby seemed nice enough for a budget hotel. However, the rooms were another matter. We went through five or six rooms until we found one that didn't smell like smoke, didn't have cigarette burns in the furniture upholstery, didn't have strange-looking stains on the wall in the bathroom, and wasn't all-around dingy. But then things took a turn for the worse. While looking for the jack for the "free internet access" (which wasn't in the room, by the way) I found a used condom stuck to the wall behind the pillow on the bed. Completely disgusting. When I confronted the man at the desk, he complained more about us trying out different rooms than the fact that I found a used condom in the final room. He was very uncooperative when I told him we were leaving the hotel (thoroughly disgusted) and demanded a refund. Honestly, I was quite surprised, as other Days Inns at which I've stayed in other parts of the country were perfectly fine. This one, however, was not.

Reviews.Title: “I would not stay there alone.”
Reviews.Author: ArleneIndiana
Reviews.Content: I was surprised by this Days Inn. Most of them are fine, if cheap, but as a single traveling business woman, I was very uncomfortable, and left to find new lodging. The staff was pleasant enough, and the lobby area was clean, if outdated, but the halls were dingy and the rooms weren't particularly clean, either. The room itself was large and had a sink and refrigerator area outside the bathroom. There was a sofa and a good-sized table and chairs, also. The lighting was overhead flourescent lighting, which didn't do anything for the appeal. The sofa, carpet, and other upholstered surfaces were stained and worn, and the refrigerator in the room was broken. My non-smoking room smelled smoky, as well. However, it was the primarily the hotel's other clientele, which, from what I saw, was primarily male, either in groups or alone, which made me nervous. I travel alone, so I'm very conscious of being one of a few women in a hotel. In all, okay for men or groups. I do not recommend if you're a safety conscious woman.
